Kids Program

Kids Garden Club

Fun, hands-on gardening activities for children ages 6-12. Learn about plants, insects, and nature through interactive games and projects!

1 hour weekly
Max 15 attendees
View Details & Register
Beginner Workshop
Free

Organic Gardening Basics

Learn the fundamentals of organic gardening including soil preparation, composting, and natural pest control. Perfect for beginners with no prior gardening experience. All materials provided!

2 hours
Max 20 attendees
View Details & Register
Advanced Workshop
$25

Seed Saving Techniques

Master the art of seed saving to preserve heirloom varieties and ensure sustainable gardening practices. This workshop is ideal for gardeners with some experience who want to take their skills to the next level.

3 hours
Max 15 attendees
View Details & Register
Advanced Workshop
$50

Permaculture Design

Explore permaculture principles and design sustainable, self-maintaining garden ecosystems. Learn about zones, guilds, and regenerative agriculture.

Full day
Max 12 attendees
View Details & Register
All Levels
$15

Composting Workshop

Learn how to turn kitchen scraps and yard waste into nutrient-rich compost for your garden. Discover the science behind composting and troubleshooting common issues.

1.5 hours
Max 30 attendees
View Details & Register
Beginner Workshop
Free

Urban Farming 101

Discover how to grow food in small spaces, from balcony gardens to community plots. Learn container gardening, vertical growing, and space-efficient techniques.

2.5 hours
Max 25 attendees
View Details & Register

Workshop Information

Registration

Click on any workshop to view upcoming dates and register. Some workshops are free, while others have a small fee to cover materials.

Location

Most workshops are held at our main garden site. Specific location details will be provided upon registration.

What to Bring

We provide all necessary materials and tools. Just bring yourself, comfortable clothes, and a willingness to learn!

Questions?

Contact us at info@tmfg.org or call (555) 123-4567 for more information.

The Morning Family Garden

Building community through sustainable gardening, education, and shared resources.
